column4: For hibernation to work you certainly need more swap space than the amount of RAM you have.
It basically dumps your memory to disk and reloads the image back in to memory when you start up.
I've always had problems with getting Hibernate to work so I don't use it much anyway.  I have 4 GB of RAM in my machine too and a 4 GB swap partition.
